channel.title: How do you delete a wall?
channel.description: I believe I know where the wall is as far as position goes, but when I delete it using deletethatobject(x, y), it doesn't remove it, so what is the proper way of doing it?

item.title: How do you delete a wall?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

nuckypie is correct. most servers have like 5 methods that add and delete stuff. Mine alone has Deletethatoblect, Deletethatwall, Makeglobalobject, and a couple more somewhere. but just add the X and Y of the wall you would like deleted in another line in the deletethatwall method. it might take a couple tries considering walls look like they are in-between 2 coordinates

Read full topic
item.source: How do you delete a wall?

item.title: How do you delete a wall?
item.dc:creator: @nickypie nickypie
item.description:
@nickypie wrote:

find

[table]
[tr]
[td][/td][/tr][/table]public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {[/td]

and above it add

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0); } public void Deletewalls() { deletethatwall(3095, 3493); deletethatwall(3095, 3492); deletethatwall(3096, 3492); deletethatwall(3097, 3493); deletethatwall(3095, 3490); deletethatwall(3096, 3490); }

then find

case 121:

and under that add

Deletewalls();

Read full topic
